column4: Ubuntu is going to need to provide more than desktop support to get into the corporate market
Canonical does, but i haven't seen any indication that they provide the level of support and expertise in the enterprise-level deployments that Redhat and SuSE do
well, let it roll. it needs time to gain the similar momentum other companies got.
yes, that is very true, Canonical has a lot of work to do, though. They have some steep competition right now.
